“It’s not just the money, that’s bad enough, it’s the fact that we do not appear to be monitoring people like this. 
“This guy has now blown himself up, but hundreds of people have gone from Britain to fight in Syria, to fight with ISIS, to become even more brutalised and then at will have come back into our communities.” 
Chilling footage of the suicide attack shows a car, riddled with explosives, drive towards Iraqi forces in the ISIS stronghold. Meet the ex-Guantanamo ISIS suicide bomber Wed, February 22, 2017 An Islamic State (ISIS) suicide bomber has been named as a British ex-Guantanamo detainee who was reportedly handed £1million in compensation from the Government. Twitter 1 of 5 The depraved terror group released a photo of what is is believed to be Ronald Fiddler, known as Abu Zakariya al-Britani , who detonated a car bomb at an Iraqi army base near the Iraqi city of Mosul. 
ISIS later released a statement saying: “The martyrdom-seeking brother Abu Zakariya al-Britani — may Allah accept him — detonated his explosives-laden vehicle on a headquarters of the Rafidhi army and its militias in Tal Kisum village, south-west of Mosul." 
A Foreign Office spokeswoman said: "The UK has advised for some time against all travel to Syria, and against all travel to large parts of Iraq. 
"As all UK consular services are suspended in Syria and greatly limited in Iraq, it is extremely difficult to confirm the whereabouts and status of British nationals in these areas." Related articles
